beats.title: Refresh Control Panel
acceptanceCriteria:
Given the refreshControlPanel operation is triggered
When the handler executes
Then it completes successfully within < 1 second
And the output is valid and meets schema
And any required events are published

Given valid input parameters
When refreshControlPanel processes them
Then results conform to expected schema
And no errors are thrown
And telemetry events are recorded with latency metrics

Given error conditions
When refreshControlPanel encounters an error
Then the error is logged with full context
And appropriate recovery is attempted
And the system remains stable

Given performance SLA of < 1 second
When refreshControlPanel executes
Then latency is consistently within target
And throughput meets baseline requirements
And resource usage stays within bounds

Given compliance and governance
When refreshControlPanel operates
Then all governance rules are enforced
And audit trails capture execution
And no compliance violations occur
beats.userStory: As an operations system, I want refreshControlPanel to execute reliably with latency < 1 second so that dependent services meet their SLA targets (goal: 99.9% success rate).

movements.userStory: As a reliability engineer, I need the update symphony to modify component state and attributes with clear telemetry and rollback semantics, meeting SLAs (resolve ≤1s, mutate ≤1s, notify ≤20ms) so UI remains consistent.
movements.businessValue: Enables real-time content updates; reduces user-visible latency; improves perceived responsiveness by 30%
